SUMMARY: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

Class Ext.ux.netbox.core.Filter

Defined in Filter.js

The base class for the filter. A filter can be of 2 type:

  1. elementary. It's a filter made only of a condition, for example foo = 'bar'
  2. composite. It's a filter made of other filters, that are connected together using a logical operator (AND, OR etc...). Actualy only the AND and OR operators are supported.
This is an abstract class ( a lot of the methods of this class just thow an exception). You should not instantie this class directly. See Ext.ux.netbox.core.CompositeFilter and Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter

Method Detail

getElementaryFilterById

Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter getElementaryFilterById(id)
    This method get an Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter by id if it is contained in this Filter. If not found return null.
    Parameters:
      String id - The id of the ElementaryFilter
    Returns:
      Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter The ElementaryFilter returned
    Throws:
      String In this base class an exception is thrown

getElementaryFiltersByFieldId

Array of Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter getElementaryFiltersByFieldId(fieldId)
    This method get an array of Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter by fieldId. If not found return an empty array.
    Parameters:
      String fieldId - The id of the field
    Returns:
      Array of Ext.ux.netbox.core.ElementaryFilter The array of ElementaryFilter with the same fieldId or an empty array
    Throws:
      String In this base class an exception is thrown

getFilterObj

Object getFilterObj()
    This method returns a javascript object representing the filter. The format of the object returned is dependant on the children implementing this class. If the class is an ElementaryFilter it returns an array of this format: 
    {fieldId : "<fieldId>", operatorId : "<operatorId>", values : [...]}
    If the class is a CompositeFilter it returns an array of this format: 
    {left : Ext.ux.netbox.core.Filter, logicalOperator : String, right : Ext.ux.netbox.core.Filter}

    Example 

    {
   left:{
     left:{fieldId:"field4",operatorId:"DATE_EQUAL",values:[{label:"12/10/2009 12:12",value:"2009-10-12 12:12:00"}]},
     logicalOperator:"AND",
     right:{fieldId:"field3",operatorId:"STRING_EQUAL",values:[{"label":"label1","value":"valore1"}]}
   },
   logicalOperator:"AND",
   right:{fieldId:"field",operatorId:"NUMBER_EQUAL",values:[{"label":5,"value":5}]}
}
    Returns:
      Object A javascript object rapresenting the filter
    Throws:
      String In this base class an exception is thrown

setFilterObj

setFilterObj(filter)
    This method sets the current filter. The format of the object is dependant on the children implementing this class. If the class is a ElementaryFilter it must be in this format: 
    {fieldId : "<fieldId>", operatorId : "<operatorId>", values : [...]}
    If it's a CompositeFilter it must be in this format: 
    {left : Ext.ux.netbox.core.Filter, logicalOperator : String, right : Ext.ux.netbox.core.Filter}
    Parameters:
      Object filter - javascript object rapresenting the filter
    Throws:
      String In this base class an exception is thrown
